Question 18) Electoral Justice was created in 1932, as part of a broad reform in the electoral process encouraged by the 1930 Revolution. Its creation was an institutional advance, ensuring that the elections had the endorsement of an organ theoretically immune to the influence of the mandates .
TAYLOR, M. Electoral Justice. In: Avritzer, L.; ANASTASIA, F. Political Reform in Brazil. Regarding the democratic regime in the country, the institution analyzed had the following role:
A) implemented direct vote to president.
B) fought the systematic fraud in the findings.
C) changed the rules for the candidacies in the dictatorship.
D) boosted the allegations of administrative corruption.
E) expanded participation with the end of the census criterion.
